title: The Disconnect between Inflation and Employment in the New Normal
content: - 12 -  Conclusion   In today’s new normal, it is important to achieve inflation and inflation expectations   around our 2 percent target on a sustained basis while guarding against financial imbalances   through active use of countercyclical tools.  We want to be mindful of the risk of financial   imbalances that could amplify any shock and help tip the economy into recession, which the   Federal Reserve has less conventional space to address in today’s low interest rate environment.    In my view, it is therefore wise to proceed cautiously, helping to sustain the expansion and   further gains in employment and with appropriate regulatory safeguards that reduce the risk of   dangerous financial imbalances.
